sec.title: AADE Needs You: 2013 Call for Nominations
sec.p: Are you a diabetes educator passionate about diabetes education? Now is your chance to become a part of AADE’s national leadership team.
By running for office on the Board of Directors or Nominating Committee, you can use your specific talents and skills to further the goals of the American Association of Diabetes Educators.

list-item.p: Take your leadership to the next level.
Make an impact on the effectiveness of AADE.
Help chart a successful course for the organization’s future.
Have a voice in shaping policies, programs, and strategies.
Exchange ideas and network with AADE leaders across the country.
Use your management, committee, and communication skills.
Increase your commitment to your career.

sec.p: Available positions for the 2013 election include these:

list-item.p: Board of Directors: Four positions, each to fill a 3-year term

sec.title: Register for AADE13 in Philadelphia!
sec.p: Don’t miss the biggest event in diabetes education—AADE13 August 7-10, 2013, at the Pennsylvania Convention Center, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. You’re certain to return home with plenty of innovative ideas and information to invigorate your professional life. Attending educational sessions, exploring the exhibit hall, and networking with a unique gathering of colleagues will give you the information you need to improve your patients’ health.

This year’s theme, “The Point of Possible: Relationships Build Strength and Opportunity,” reinforces AADE’s belief in promoting a team-based approach to diabetes education and care and improved management of chronic illnesses.

AADE13 will be packed with engaging general session speakers, 100 original education sessions, and novel educational formats designed to help you integrate the information you will learn into patient care goals.

Don’t miss the exhibit hall featuring nearly 250 exhibitors showcasing the latest developments and advances in research, technology, and delivery of diabetes education. Be sure to attend a corporate symposium and product theater.
Register by March 28 to save $200 on your full program registration fee, and save an additional $100 when you book your housing at the same time.
To learn more about AADE13 and to register, visit www.diabeteseducator.org/am3.

sec.title: Core Concepts® Available Live or Online in 2013
sec.p: AADE’s popular Core Concepts® course returns in 2 formats this year—live and online. Both formats are worth more than 20 hours of CE and are facilitated by a multidisciplinary team consisting of a nurse, a dietitian, and a pharmacist. You’ll get in-depth learning directly from experts in all aspects of diabetes education.

Our 3-day long live course will take place 4 times next year: in San Francisco, CA (March 5-7); Charlotte, NC (April 16-18); Chicago, IL (September 10-12); and San Antonio, TX (October 7-9). Register early to get the best rates and hotel discounts.

Our 9-week online course is perfect for those who want to take the course from the convenience of their homes or offices. You’ll complete reading assignments from The Art and Science of Diabetes Self Management Education, 2nd Edition, and then you’ll apply the lessons and get feedback in a facilitated online discussion forum.
Visit www.diabeteseducator.org/coreconceptscourse for more information on either format of the Core Concepts® course.

sec.title: Maximize Your Reimbursement With AADE’s Newest Online Course: DSMT Reimbursement: Essentials
sec.p: Struggling with reimbursement? DSMT Reimbursement: Essentials can help. This latest AADE online course is designed to provide you and your billing staff with the information you need to better manage and maximize your billing for DSMT, MNT, and other related reimbursable services.
This self-study course is divided into 4 modules:

list-item.p: Reimbursement Overview: Overview, the payer mix, how physician payments are calculated, Medicare reimbursement, secondary payers, flexible spending accounts (FSA), health savings accounts (HSA), documentation requirements, advanced beneficiary notice (ABN), and CPT, HCPCS, ICD-9/10 codes

Reimbursement for Diabetes Self-Management Education (DSMT): Overview of DSMT, coverage criteria, DSMT program accreditation process, coding and payment of G-codes, who can bill for DSMT, commercial payer reimbursement for DSMT and MNT, criteria for expanding program to off-site locations, federally qualified health centers (FQHC), rural health centers (RHC), DSMT/MNT state mandates

Medical Nutrition Therapy (MNT): Overview of MNT, historical perspective, coverage criteria, who can bill for MNT, national provider identification number (NPI), distinctions between DSMT and MNT Medicare benefits, MNT billing codes, maximizing reimbursement

Telehealth, Preventive Services, and KDE: Overview of telehealth/telemedicine, eligible telehealth providers, criteria for delivering DSMT/MNT via telehealth, billing for telehealth delivery of DSMT and MNT, rural health professional shortage area (HSPA), kidney disease education (KDE), KDE coding, Medicare diabetes screening, continuous glucose monitoring (CGM), insulin pumps, shared medical appointments (SMA), the Affordable Care Act and the implications for diabetes care.

sec.p: For more information or to register: http://www.diabeteseducator.org/product/RE001. Member price: $140; non-member price: $190. This course provides four CEs for nurses, dietitians, pharmacists, regardless of membership status.

sec.title: DSMT Program Management
sec.p: Whether you are new to DSME/T program management or are looking to sharpen your business management and operational skills, AADE’s newest online, self-study course is for you. Earn CE while learning how to manage and grow a successful DSME/T program. This course is applicable to all DSM delivery models including physician-, hospital outpatient-, or pharmacy-based programs or independent practitioner programs.
The course is divided in 6 modules:

list-item.p: Module 1: Starting a DSME/T Program: Assessment and analysis of the target population; resource needs; SWOT analysis of competitive programs; creating mission and vision statements; creating a business plan

Module 2: Operational Management: Resource assessment; program goal setting; program accreditation; “portable” DSME programs & “staggered start-ups”; off-site locations; program policies, procedures & legal considerations; electronic systems/software; equipment/furniture/supplies; program & office forms; team & patient work flows
Module 3: Financial Management: Program revenue expectations, revenue sources & fees; financial reporting 7 projection; positive cash flow strategies; profitability

Module 4: Clinical Management: Clinical process for implementing DSME; adherence evidence-based standards of diabetes medical care and treatment, AADE7™ self-care behaviors, National Standards for DSME and Support; documentation standards compliance; cultural competence
Module 5: Marketing Strategies: Identifying patient populations & secondary target markets; developing & implementing a marketing plan

Module 6: Quality Improvement/CQI: Metrics for evaluating program operations, financial growth of DSME Program; benchmarking & and r\source identification; patient chart auditing; maintenance of instructional staff’s professional designations & credentials; maintenance of insurance provider status; continuous quality improvement (CQI) process; evaluation of program outcomes

sec.p: For more information or to register: http://www.diabeteseducator.org/product/PRMG001. Member price: $200; non-member price: $250. This course provides six CEs for nurses, dietitians, pharmacists, regardless of membership status.

sec.title: New Free Online Service for Members: Your Own Personalized Web Page
sec.p: At AADE12, Health Monitor Network (AADE’s partner in patient education and publisher of the member-benefit magazine, Diabetes Health Monitor; bimonthly circulation 1.5 million) introduced a free online service that can help AADE members communicate effectively with patients while promoting their practice.
This service allows AADE members like you to create their own personalized Web page:

list-item.p: Send patients and other HCPs to your Web page through our “Find a Diabetes Educator” link as well as your own personalized Web address.
Manage your online presence and offer high-quality patient education, savings, tools, and important information to your patients.
Determine how to share your background, education, accreditations, affiliations, accepted insurance plans, community events, and more.

sec.p: It’s easy to set up, it’s secure, and it’s offered free by a trusted AADE partner. To learn more, visit www.healthmonitor.com/AADE/welcome.html.
